revised_title: New Particles and Quantum Numbers: A Discussion on the Discovery of Heavy Particles
tldr: In 1974, the discovery of new heavy particles with long lifetimes revolutionized the field of elementary particle physics. This article discusses the discovery of these particles, their properties, and the implications for our understanding of weak interactions and quantum numbers. The discovery of the vJ particles and their family members opened up new domains in hadronic and possibly leptonic physics, leading to further research and the exploration of theoretical ideas unifying weak and electromagnetic interactions.
